duties_responsibilities.duty: Collects patient health data, performs initial assessment, and records relevant data on the nursing component of the Interdisciplinary Admission Assessment.
Plans and implements the treatment plan, observes and evaluates the patient's progress, and documents pertinent observations.
Incorporates discharge planning into the admission process, analyzes assessment data to determine problem identification, and identifies expected outcomes individualized to the patient.
Recognizes hazards to patient safety, provides education to the patient and family, and communicates the plan of care to promote continuity of care.
Implements the plan of care for each patient, adapts nursing procedures to meet the needs of the individual patient, and evaluates the patient's progress toward attainment of outcomes.

Provides care that demonstrates ethical beliefs and respect for patient's rights, maintains knowledge and proficiency in the clinical area and age group served, and complies with staff meeting attendance requirement.

education_certification.credential: Professional knowledge of nursing theory and practice acquired through completion of a two-year training at an accredited School of Nursing, Current New York State license or Permit as a Registered Professional Nurse
